TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Include the most important contacts including: * Personal contacts e.g., next of kin, in case of emergency contact, lasting power of attorney, dependents, informal carers etc. * Health/care professional contacts e.g., social worker, hospital clinician, care coordinator, key worker, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc. Name, relationship, role (if formal role), contact details and availability, e.g. out of hours.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: About me

Model.name: What is most important to me

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of what is most important to you.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of what is most important to you Emergency Information : - Include any essential information that any professional in health and social care should know about the you in any situation, including emergencies. Other Information : - This could include : - Values, Spirituality/religion, Ethnicity, Culture, Pets, Goals and aspirations, Meaningful activities including leisure activities, visiting places, sport and exercise, listening to music, employment, education, volunteering

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

Model.name: People who are important to me

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of who is important to you and why.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of who is important to you and why. They could be family members, carers, friends, members of staff etc. Include how you want the people important to you to be engaged and involved in your care and support in both emergency and normal situations. Include how you stay connected to the people important to you. Who should not be contacted or consulted about your care and support and why, if you wish to say

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

Model.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of how you communicate normally.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of how you communicate normally including any communication aids you use, for example a hearing aid. Include your preferred language of communication, if your first language is not English. Include how you would communicate when you are in pain or distress. Include how you communicate choices. Include how you give feedback or raise a concern. Include how you like to receive information Describe how you would like others to engage and communicate with you, including how you would like to be addressed.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell Include any causes that might result in you becoming unwell and strategies for avoiding or addressing the causes. For example, not drinking enough water could cause constipation. Include any signs that indicate you might be becoming unwell. On a bad day describe what is different about what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel. Include how your everyday life is affected by any medical conditions e.g. dementia and any symptoms e.g. itchiness, cough, pain and how you manage those conditions. Include past health issues or experiences that need to be considered Include your wellbeing and lifestyle goals and aspirations

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do). Things you want someone to do might include (for example): - Talk to me not to my carer, remind me to take my medication, encourage me to wash my hands regularly, explain to me what is happening and why, respond to my communication. A description of things you do not want someone supporting you to do might include (for example): - Discussing or asking questions about certain topics, making assumptions about something, providing support when it is not wanted, talking to you in a certain way, undergoing a specific intervention or taking a medication the person does not want.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

Model.name: How and when to support me

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you. This could include support needs in an emergency situation (for example taking blood) This could include support you need to maintain important routines or to carry out particular activities, for example: - Personal care routines, Eating and drinking, Bedtime routines, Taking medications, Moving and transitioning This could also include support needed with:- wearing glasses/hearing aids/false teeth etc, making informed choices or understanding dangers and risks, managing your emotions, moods and behaviours, memory or confusion. Include how your support needs change in different environments. Include any triggers that might result in you needing further support and strategies for avoiding or addressing the triggers. Include how you want the support to be provided.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you. This could include a short history of your life (where you have worked, where you lived, important events in your life, important people in your past life). This could include a short profile of your current life:- your work / study, your aspirations, your skills, your networks, things you like e.g. particular foods, places, a football team and things you like to talk about, things you dislike This could also include any care and support preferences that have not been included elsewhere.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Where relevant, this is a record of name, relationship/role and contact details of the individual who supported the person to write this section e.g. carer, family member, advocate, professional.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The link to the person's multimedia file

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Link to URL

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The individual requirements of the person.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A record of reasonable adjustments that must be provided by the service to comply with the Equality Act 2010.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a reasonable adjustment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Under the Equality Act 2010 , organisations have a legal duty to make changes in their approach or provision to ensure that services are as accessible to people with disabilities as they are for everybody else. These changes are called reasonable adjustments. Reasonable adjustments can mean alterations to buildings by providing lifts, wide doors, ramps and tactile signage, but may also mean changes to policies, procedures and staff training to ensure that services work equally well for people with physical or sensory disabilities, learning disabilities or long-term conditions such as dementia. Other adjustments include longer appointments, providing easy read materials or communications via a carer. This legal duty is anticipatory which means a service should know about a person’s need for adjustments when they are referred or present for care. For this to happen, and for optimum care to be delivered, adjustments need to be recorded and shared across the NHS.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - 1108111000000107 |Requires reasonable adjustments for health and care access (Equality Act 2010) (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The reasonable adjustment required e.g. requires specific contact method, requires communication professional

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for reasonable adjustment

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - Accessible information standard ^999002121000000109 |Accessible information - communication support simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| ^999002151000000104 |Accessible information - requires communication professional simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| ^999002131000000106 |Accessible information - requires specific contact method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| ^999002141000000102 |Accessible information - requires specific information format simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)| Refsets for other categories in development

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The health problem or issue experienced by the person resulting in their attendance. This may include disease state, medical condition, response and reactions to therapies. e.g., blackout, dizziness, chest pain, follow up from admission, falls, a specific procedure, investigation or treatment.

TaggedValue.name: description

Model.name: Plan and requested actions record entry

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a person's identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including the person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Indicates whether the person or their legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments. A record of the agreement of the decisions made.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: This records the decisions reached during conversation between the individual and health and care professional about future plans and also records progress.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Any strengths and assets the person has relating to their goals and hopes about their health and well-being.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value associated with the person's strengths. Could be derived from the assessment of the person e.g. 300738008 |Able to participate in leisure activities (finding)|

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - 1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s strengths (in free text). If the strengths are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded strength.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of the person needs, concerns or problems

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value associated with the person's needs, concerns or problems.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s needs, concerns or problems (in free text). If the needs, concerns or problems are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded need, concern or problem.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value associated with the person's goals, aim's and hopes. e.g. 999002111000000103 |Occupational therapy goals simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s goals and hopes (in free text). If the goals and hopes are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded goal or hope.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Assessment of the person's motivations to achieve this goal, how important the goal is to the person on a scale of 1-10.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Numeric scale 1 - 10

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Actions or activities the person or others plan to take to achieve the person's goals and the resources required to do this.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: What the action is and how it is to be carried out?

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the action.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - <<71388002 |Procedure| OR <<129125009 |Procedure with explicit context|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s actions (in free text). If the actions are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded action.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Name and role (e.g. person, carer, GP, OT, etc.) of the person, or a team, carrying out the proposed action, and, if relevant where action should take place.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The name of the professional or person carrying out the proposed action.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The role of the person providing the service.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: FHIR values set : - ukcorepractitionerrolecode

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The name of the team.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Planned date, time, or interval, as relevant

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Suggested strategies for potential problems.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The status of the action or activity e.g. in progress, done, refused

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the person's activity status

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - ^999000081000000105 | Care planning action context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Any supplementary or personalised information for the person's activity status

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: How confident the person feels to carry out the action associated to the goal.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Numeric score 1 - 10

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Date when action/activity record was last updated

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: When the action evaluation needs to be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Date and time.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Details of the person's stage goals

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: A specific sub-goal that is related to the overall goal as agreed by the person in collaboration with a professional.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded expression associated with the person's stage goal.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s stage goal (in free text). If the stage goal is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded stage goal.

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The outcome of the stage goal

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value for the person's stage goal outcome.

TaggedValue.value: Any supplementary and personalised information relating to the person's outcome.

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Outcomes of each of the person’s goals, aims and targets. Includes comments recorded by the person, date and status.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The coded value associated with the person's overall goal outcome

TaggedValue.name: valueSets
TaggedValue.value: SNOMED CT: - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The person’s outcome (in free text) of a goal. If the outcome is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded outcome.

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The status associated with the person's overall goal.

Model.name: Agreed with person or legitimate representative

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.value: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: Reference other care planning documents, including the type, location and date. This may include condition-specific plans, advance care plans, end of life care plan, etc.

TaggedValue.name: description

TaggedValue.value: Free text

TaggedValue.name: description
TaggedValue.value: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
